intro: Jacksonia remota, commonly known as the New Zealand fleabane, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Jacksonia remota is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
